alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:18AM EST until February 21 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Buffalo NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Allegheny River At Olean affecting Cattaraugus County. Allegheny River At Salamanca affecting Cattaraugus County. .Moderate to heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Allegheny River...including Olean, Salamanca...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Allegheny River At Olean. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage, flooding possible on Union Street in Allegany and East Riverside Drive 1 to 3 miles upstream of Olean. Some farm lands along the river are also impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 3.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 15.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall to 14.5 feet and begin rising again early Saturday morning. It will rise to 15.0 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.6 feet on 03/16/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
